What's Jekyll?

02/06/12 on Jekyll

Jekyll is a static site generator, an open-source tool for creating simple yet powerful websites of all shapes and sizes. From the project’s readme:

Jekyll is a simple, blog aware, static site generator. It takes a template directory […] and spits out a complete, static website suitable for serving with Apache or your favorite web server. This is also the engine behind GitHub Pages, which you can use to host your project’s page or blog right here from GitHub.

It’s an immensely useful tool and one we encourage you to use here with Hyde.

Find out more by visiting the project on GitHub.

About

Huy Trinh was born in Vietnam 2 dozen years ago. He’s about to stop referring to himself in a 3rd person, ‘cause I’m wring this myself… Here’s the fact - I’m just a normal student who was kind of lucky to know what my passion very soon, from the moment I joined Lahti UAS for studying BIT degree. I wanted to be a web developer. I have been spending lots of my time making websites, especially web apps. Most of them are for university’s projects, and the rest are my side/ hobby projects I made to fulfill some of my needs or for fun :D I am very keen on learning new techonologies to support my field. My favourite subjects at the moment are Docker and Continuous Delivery.

Beside coding, watching movies, especially TV shows is my favourite thing to do. I can binge-watch a whole season just for 2 or 3 days :P. I believe we can learn a lot from movie quotes.
I don’t always have time and budget to travel but when I do, I try to visit many places as I can because I really enjoy seeing new things, meeting new people, trying new food and so on.
